summary: This document is a U.S. Department of Justice foreign travel questionnaire and itinerary for a U.S. Attorney's Office employee traveling from New York to an unspecified foreign location in February 2020. The purpose of the travel is to interview and debrief a witness in the ongoing, sensitive investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell identified as a subject.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the case (USAO # 2018R01618) for which the foreign travel is being conducted.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, believed to be a citizen of the U.S., U.K., and France.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same ongoing investigation (In re Jeffrey Epstein).

events.title: Foreign Travel for Witness Interview
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office employee travels from New York to an unspecified foreign location to interview and debrief a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: High Threat Security Overseas Seminar Completion
events.description: A certificate was awarded for completion of the HTSOS training, referenced as a prerequisite for the 2020 travel.

keyFacts: The document is a travel authorization for U.S. government personnel to conduct witness interviews abroad in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in February 2020.
The case is identified as 'In re Jeffrey Epstein, USAO # 2018R01618' and is described as an ongoing and very sensitive investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a subject of the investigation, with her multiple citizenships (U.S., U.K., France) noted.
The travel party included an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA), an FBI Special Agent (SA), and an NYPD Detective.
Foreign authorities were consulted and had cleared the visit, indicating international cooperation in the Epstein investigation.
